smarty.models package¶

smarty.models.api module¶

smarty.models.api.SAMPLINGS_METHODS = ('train_test_split', 'cross_val')¶

Available samplings method for auto model evaluation

smarty.models.api.evaluate_model(ds, model, sampling_method='train_test_split', *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Splits ds and trains the model according to sampling_method, than evaluates it also according to sampling_method

Parameters:

  • ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source

  • model (class) – unfitted model, has to have .fit(), .predict(), .clean_copy() methods

  • metric (function) – evaluation mertic, has to accept y and y_pred and return score: for pre-defined see smarty.models.metrics

  • sampling_method (str) – one of smarty.models.api.SAMPLINGS_METHODS

Params args, kwargs:

additional params that will be passed to sampling function and model methods

Raises:

AssertionError if sampling_method not recognized

Returns:

score or list of scores

Note

If drop_reminder not passed in kwargs, cross_val_split by default will drop last fold if not full

smarty.models.dumb module¶

Note

Dumb models does not support batching and doesn’t have .evaluate() method implemented

smarty.models.dumb.DUMB_SOLVERS = ('random', 'zero')¶
Variables:

  • random (str) – model will return random value that it saw during .fit(), for classification only (or regression but it will return only seen targets)

  • zero (str) – model will return most common value for classification, mean / median value for regression

class smarty.models.dumb.RandomModel(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

For each target column, returns random value from it, classification only

clean_copy()[source]¶
Returns:

new unfited model with same parameters

evaluate(ds, loss=None, *args, **kwargs)¶

Evaluates model on the ds according to loss and prints its score

Parameters:

  • ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source, needs to have specified target classes and shape[1] simmilar to seen in .fit()

  • loss – evaluation loss, has to accept y and y_pred and return score: for pre-defined see smarty.models.metrics. If not provided, loss given on model initialization will be used

Params args, kwargs:

will be passed to .predict()

Returns:

score

fit(ds, *args, **kwargs)¶

‘Trains’ the model.

Parameters:

ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source, needs to have specified target classes

Returns:

self

get_params()¶

Returns dict of parameters allowing exact coping of a model

plot(ds, data_idx=0, target_idx=0, *args, **kwargs)¶

Creates a 2D plot where x-axis is data_idx, and y-axis is target_idx. Plots both their value and prediction curve

Parameters:

  • ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source, needs to have specified target classes and shape[1] simmilar to seen in .fit()

  • data_idx (int) – data column index used as x-axis

  • target_class (int) – target class index used as y-axis (0 - first target class, 1 - second (if exists) and so on)

Params args, kwargs:

will be passed to .predict()

predict(ds, *args, **kwargs)¶
Parameters:

ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source, needs to have specified target classes and shape[1] simmilar to seen in .fit()

Returns:

2D np.ndarray, where each culumn holds prediction for one of the targets

Raises:

AssertionError if model is not fitted

set_params(params)¶

Set params to model’s and solver’s dict

Parameters:

params (dict) – dict of parameters, to indicate that they belong to solver name should start with ‘root__’

smarty.models.dumb.ZERO_MODES = ('regression_mean', 'regression_median', 'classification')¶
Variables:

  • regression_mean (str) – smarty.models.dumb.ZeroRuleModel will return mean value for each column

  • regression_median (str) – smarty.models.dumb.ZeroRuleModel will return meadian value for each column

  • classification (str) – smarty.models.dumb.ZeroRuleModel will return most common value for each column

class smarty.models.dumb.ZeroRuleModel(mode='classification', *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

For each target column it returns predictions according to the rule defined by mode

Parameters:

mode (str) – one of smarty.models.dumb.ZERO_MODES

clean_copy()[source]¶
Returns:

new unfited model with same parameters

evaluate(ds, loss=None, *args, **kwargs)¶

Evaluates model on the ds according to loss and prints its score

Parameters:

  • ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source, needs to have specified target classes and shape[1] simmilar to seen in .fit()

  • loss – evaluation loss, has to accept y and y_pred and return score: for pre-defined see smarty.models.metrics. If not provided, loss given on model initialization will be used

Params args, kwargs:

will be passed to .predict()

Returns:

score

‘Trains’ the model.

Parameters:

ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source, needs to have specified target classes

plot(ds, data_idx=0, target_idx=0, *args, **kwargs)¶

Creates a 2D plot where x-axis is data_idx, and y-axis is target_idx. Plots both their value and prediction curve

Parameters:

  • ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source, needs to have specified target classes and shape[1] simmilar to seen in .fit()

  • data_idx (int) – data column index used as x-axis

  • target_class (int) – target class index used as y-axis (0 - first target class, 1 - second (if exists) and so on)

Params args, kwargs:

will be passed to .predict()

predict(ds, *args, **kwargs)¶
Parameters:

ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source, needs to have specified target classes and shape[1] simmilar to seen in .fit()

Returns:

2D np.ndarray, where each culumn holds prediction for one of the targets

Raises:

AssertionError if model is not fitted

set_params(params)¶

Set params to model’s and solver’s dict

Parameters:

params (dict) – dict of parameters, to indicate that they belong to solver name should start with ‘root__’

smarty.models.dumb.evaluate_dumb(ds, metric=<function mean_squared_error>, solver='random', *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Shortcut to evaluate_model that is “dumb”, choosen by string parameter mode

Parameters:

  • ds (DataSet) – a DataSet - data source

  • metric (function) – evaluation mertic, has to accept y and y_pred and return score: for pre-defined see smarty.models.metrics

  • solver (str) – one of smarty.models.dumb.DUMB_SOLVERS

Params args, kwargs:

additional params that will be passed to sampling function and model methods

Raises:

AssertionError if solver not recognized

Returns:

score or list of scores

Note

For solver=zero you need to specify mode, by default it is classification, see smarty.models.dumb.ZERO_MODES

smarty.models.linear module¶

smarty.models.linear.LINEAR_SOLVERS = ('mbgd', 'norm_eq')¶
Variables:

  • mbgd (str) – Mini-Batch Gradient Descent

  • norm_eq (str) – Normal Equation

class smarty.models.linear.LinearRegression(loss=<function mean_squared_error>, solver='mbgd', learning_rate=0.0001, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Linear model

Parameters:

  • loss – evaluation loss, has to accept y and y_pred and return score: for pre-defined see smarty.models.metrics

  • solver (str) – solver, one of smarty.models.linear.LINEAR_SOLVERS

  • learning_rate (float) – learning rate, used only for solver=”sgd”

Variables:

  • bias_ (np.ndarray) – model’s bias term

  • coefs_ (np.ndarray) – model’s coefficients

  • learning_rate_ (float) – model’s learning rate

Note

If you are using solver=”sgd”, you can plot training curve via .plot_training() or see each eopch losses - list at .solver_.costs_

clean_copy()[source]¶
Returns:

new unfited model with same parameters

  • loss – evaluation loss, has to accept y and y_pred and return score: for pre-defined see smarty.models.metrics. If not provided, loss given on model initialization will be used

Params args, kwargs:

will be passed to .predict()

class smarty.models.linear.Perceptron(loss=<function accuracy>, learning_rate=0.0001, threshold=0.0, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Perceptron binary classifier

Parameters:

  • loss – evaluation loss, has to accept y and y_pred and return score: for pre-defined see smarty.models.metrics

  • learning_rate (float) – learning rate

  • threshold (float) – values higher than threshold will be classified as 1, rest as 0

Variables:

  • bias_ (np.ndarray) – model’s bias term

  • coefs_ (np.ndarray) – model’s coefficients

  • learning_rate_ (float) – model’s learning rate

Note

You can plot training curve via .plot_training() or see each eopch losses - list at .solver_.costs_

Returns:

new unfited model with same parameters

smarty.models.tree module¶

class smarty.models.tree.DecisionTreeClassifier(max_depth=3, min_samples=5, loss=<function accuracy>, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Decision tree model

Parameters:

  • loss – evaluation loss, has to accept y and y_pred and return score: for pre-defined see smarty.models.metrics

  • max_depth (int) – maximum number of splits

  • min_samples (int) – minimum number of samples each split must have

class smarty.models.neighbours.KNNClassifier(loss=<function accuracy>, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

K Nearest Neighbors Classifier Default k is 5, to change it pass it in .predict(), .fit() or .evaluate()

smarty.models.utils module¶

smarty.models.utils.display_conf(conf, classes, display_names=False)[source]¶

Displays the calculated confusion matrix conf

Parameters:

  • conf (list of lists | 2D np.ndarray) – the confusion matrix

  • classes (list | 1D np.ndarray) – classes names, where ith name is linked to ith column of confusion matrix

  • display_names (bool) – whether to display names provided in classes

smarty.models.base module¶

class smarty.models.base.BaseModel[source]¶

Bases: object

Base model, to work it needs to be provided with coefs_, bias_, solver_ and loss function
